title: libert19
author: libert19
content: So I'm paying $1-$2 to transfer trc20 usdt. If I stake for free transfers, it requires couple thousand trx staked. Had heard tron blockchain is cheapest to use but it's not so for me. What am I missing?

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Tron token transcation fee requires Energy and Bandwidth Points. Energy consumption depends on the smart contract of the token itself, if it is widely used, the required energy increases. On other hand, Bandwidth Points are given free daily for some amount and might increase if you stake TRXs. If your current Bandwidth Points daily are fully consumed, another TRX requires to be spent for the transaction, though it will be burned. So, it seems you have already emptied out your current BP, thus it requires more TRX for transactions.For further detailed explanation of how the TRX fee works, refer to below links:https://developers.tron.network/docs/resource-model#bandwidthhttps://developers.tron.network/docs/resource-model#energy

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: Quote from: libert19 on February 14, 2023, 03:29:16 PM...Had heard tron blockchain is cheapest to use but it's not so for me. They haven't told you the full story I guess? Yes Tron could be the cheapest for people who are long on Tron but most likely not ideal for one-time or not so frequent users. It's probably cheaper to send via centralized platforms than using a non-custodial wallet.Maybe just eat that $1 - $2 fee if you are just moving funds and not planning to hold TRX for long-term.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Now many users are facing a sharp increase in TRON commissions, many exchanges and wallets have increased minimum commissions several times, TRON at the moment does not look a profitable option for transfers, as it is close to Ethereum. Use TronLink, block some TRX and then commissions will be much cheaper for you.
